cards.front: What type of equation models continuous-time systems?
What type of equation models discrete-time systems?
What is the time constant τ of an RC circuit?
cards.back: τ = RC. It determines the speed of response. After t = τ, the response reaches ~63.2% of final value.

cards.front: How do you determine the order of a differential equation system?
cards.back: By the highest derivative present. If d²y/dt² is highest, it's second order.

cards.front: What does an ADC (Analog-to-Digital Converter) do?
cards.back: Converts continuous-time signals to discrete-time signals by sampling at regular intervals and quantizing values.

cards.front: What is the discrete-time equivalent of differentiation?
cards.back: The backward difference: y[n] - y[n-1]. Also called the first difference operator.

cards.front: What is the discrete-time equivalent of integration?
cards.back: The accumulator (running sum): y[n] = Σx[k] from k=-∞ to n

cards.front: Give an example of a real-world discrete-time system.
cards.back: Bank account (balance updated monthly), digital filters, sampled control systems, or any computer-based system.

cards.front: What does the equation dy/dt + y/RC = x(t)/RC represent?
cards.back: A first-order RC circuit (low-pass filter) with time constant τ = RC.

cards.front: Why can discrete systems approximate continuous systems?
cards.back: With sufficiently high sampling rate (per Nyquist), discrete samples capture all information in a band-limited continuous signal.
